title: EL Injection on Webcenter PortalRCE on Apache Struts
description: Webcenter portal allows authenticated user inject expression language (EL) in component page lead to RCE
timeline: 11/04/2020– Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
01/07/2020– The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: RCE on Weblogic Server via T3 Protocol
description: Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via IIOP, T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Oracle WebLogic Server
timeline: 2020-03-10 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
07/04/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: RCE on Weblogic Server via T3 Protocol
description: Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via IIOP, T3 to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of Oracle WebLogic Server
timeline: 2020-03-05 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
07/04/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Path Traversal on Oracle E-Business Suite
description: Oracle E-Business Suite version 12.1.1-12.1.3 allows remote attackers to manipulate paths to read files arbitrarily without authentication due to improper input validation.
timeline: 02/01/220 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
19/04/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: VCSA-21
1 click RCE on Joomla before 3.9.15
description: An issue was discovered in Joomla! before 3.9.15. A missing CSRF token check in the LESS compiler of com_templates and unsafe handle of outputing error message of Joomla.
timeline: 18/12/2019 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
29/1/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: XXE on Microsoft sharepoint
description: Unsafe use of Xml parser so that an attacker can craft a malicious backup file leads to arbitrary files's read on the server.
timeline: 11/03/2020 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
14/03/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Local Privilege Escalation within Spring Webflux Multipart Request Handling
description: In Spring Framework, versions 5.2.x prior to 5.2.15 and versions 5.3.x prior to 5.3.7, a WebFlux application is vulnerable to a privilege escalation: by (re)creating the temporary storage directory, a locally authenticated malicious user can read or modify files that have been uploaded to the WebFlux application, or overwrite arbitrary files with multipart request data.
solution: Users of affected versions should apply the following mitigation. 5.3.x users should upgrade to 5.3.7. 5.2.x users should upgrade to 5.2.15. No other steps are necessary. Releases that have fixed this issue include:
timeline: 30/04/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
25/05/2021 - Initial vulnerability report first published.

title: RCE on Oracle E-Business Suite
description: Oracle E-Business Suite version 12.1.3 allow attacker without authentication can remote code execution on the vulnerable server due to Java deserialize with unstrusted data.
timeline: 19/06/2020 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
19/10/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Joomla Core - XSS in Protostar and Beez3
description: Inadequate handling of CSS selectors in the Protostar and Beez3 JavaScript allow XSS attacks.
timeline: 24/02/2020 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
10/03/2020 – The vendor publish the patch

title: Microsoft Azure DevOps Server Spoofing Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Azure DevOps Server Spoofing Vulnerability
timeline: 15/10/2020 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
08/12/2020 – The vendor publish the patch

title: Microsoft Exchange Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: The vulnerability occurs due to improper validation of cmdlet arguments.
timeline: 17/09/2020 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
08/12/2020 – The vendor publish the patch

title: Microsoft Office SharePoint XSS Vulnerability
description: A cross-site-scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists when Microsoft SharePoint Server does not properly sanitize a specially crafted web request to an affected SharePoint server. An authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to an affected SharePoint server.
timeline: 12/05/2020 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
14/07/2020 – The vendor publish the patch

title: Microsoft ASP.NET and .NET Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when ASP.NET or .NET web applications running on IIS improperly allow access to cached files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain access to restricted files.
timeline: 10/04/2020 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
11/08/2020 – The vendor publish the patch

title: Microsoft Exchange Server Spoofing Vulnerability
description: A cross-site-scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists when Microsoft Exchange Server does not properly sanitize a specially crafted web request to an affected Exchange server. An authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to an affected server.
timeline: 19/12/2019 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
10/03/2020 – The vendor publish the patch

title: Microsoft Exchange Server Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Microsoft Exchange Server. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same rights as any other user of the Exchange server. This could allow the attacker to perform activities such as accessing the mailboxes of other users.
timeline: 19/03/2019 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
09/07/2019 – The vendor publish the patch

title: Microsoft Exchange Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Exchange through the deserialization of metadata via PowerShell. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run arbitrary code in the context of the logged in user.
timeline: 18/02/2019 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
12/11/2019 – The vendor publish the patch

title: XXE on Zimbra Collaboration Server
description: mailboxd component in Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite 8.7.x before 8.7.11p10 has an XML External Entity injection (XXE) vulnerability.
timeline: 2019 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
30/05/2019 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

version: Zimbra Collaboration Server before 8.6.0 P9, 8.7.11 P9, 8.8.10 P6 and 8.8.11 P2
title: SSRF on Zimbra Collaboration Server
description: Zimbra Collaboration Suite before 8.6 patch 13, 8.7.x before 8.7.11 patch 10, and 8.8.x before 8.8.10 patch 7 or 8.8.x before 8.8.11 patch 3 allows SSRF via the ProxyServlet component.
timeline: 2019 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
06/06/2019 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

version: Zimbra Collaboration Server before 8.7.11 P9, 8.8.9 P8, 8.8.10 P4 and 8.8.11
title: XXE on Zimbra ZxChat component
description: ZxChat (aka ZeXtras Chat), as used for zimbra-chat and zimbra-talk in Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite 8.7 and 8.8 and in other products, allows XXE attacks, as demonstrated by a crafted XML request to mailboxd.
timeline: 2018 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
29/05/2019 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: RCE on LimeSurvey
description: LimeSurvey 2.6.x before 2.6.7, 2.7x.x before 2.73.1, and 3.x before 3.4.2 mishandles application/controller/InstallerController.php after installation, which allows remote attackers to access the configuration file.
timeline: 2018 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
23/02/2018 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Header Bypass Vulnerability
description: A vulnerability in the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) scanner of Cisco AsyncOS Software for Cisco Email Security Appliances (ESA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass configured user filters on the device. The vulnerability is due to improper error handling of a malformed MIME header in an email attachment. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an email with a crafted MIME attachment. For example, a successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass configured user filters to drop the email. The malformed MIME headers may not be RFC compliant. However, some mail clients could still allow users to access the attachment, which may not have been properly filtered by the device. Cisco Bug IDs: CSCvf44666.
timeline: 2017 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
29/11/2017 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

version: Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX before R2 2017 SP1 and Sitefinity before 10.0.6412.0
title: RCE in Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX
description: Telerik.Web.UI.dll in Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX before R2 2017 SP1 and Sitefinity before 10.0.6412.0 does not properly protect Telerik.Web.UI.DialogParametersEncryptionKey or the MachineKey, which makes it easier for remote attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms, leading to a MachineKey leak, arbitrary file uploads or downloads, XSS, or ASP.NET ViewState compromise.
timeline: 06/06/2017: Discovered the vulnerability.
13/06/2017: Reported to Progress.
03/07/2017: Security advisory released.

title: VCSA-2
RCE on Apache Struts
description: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.24.1 allows remote attackers to manipulate Struts internals, alter user sessions, or affect container settings via vectors involving a top object.
timeline: 20/03/2015 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
01/07/2015 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch
